metadata.Title: CVE-2022-42927 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description: A same-origin policy violation could have allowed the theft of cross-origin URL entries, leaking the result of a redirect, via performance.getEntries(). This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 102.4, Firefox ESR < 102.4, and Firefox < 106. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42927` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: thunderbird - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1 No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1').
